page.title: 12HOUSING
page.content: Housing has developed alongside the colliery. The original development was of a ribbon nature. After the 1939/45 war the Kiveton Park Rural District {Council}built two large blocks of {Council} housing. In the late sixties a large area of {Coal {Board }property was built with a local nickname of{White City. }This can be attributed to the nature of construction- large slabs of white concrete bolted together. This accommodation was used to house an influx of workers from Scotland and Wales from worked out pits to one with a future. From 1983 to 1985 two areas of {private} development have taken place. The majority of the people who reside in this new property travel outside Kiveton to work in Worksop, Sheffield and Rotherham.
